The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth, report shows
subhead: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge. This is the key takeaway of the third major report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty, which emphasizes how political choices can reverse these trends.

title: Devastation and trauma linger in Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah
subhead: In Mawathura, in the heart of the country, rescue teams are searching for the bodies of victims of the torrential rains and landslides that ravaged the region.

title: Two Paris concerts rally support and raise funds for Palestine
subhead: Two concerts in the French capital raised funds for Gaza on Tuesday: one at the Zénith venue, spearheaded by Yann Tiersen, Pomme and Aloïse Sauvage, and the other at La Flèche d'Or, under the direction of Rallye.

President Nicusor Dan: 'In Romania, we do not have a real policy to defend against disinformation'
subhead: Romania borders Ukraine and is at the front line against Russian interference, which led to the cancellation of the presidential election a year ago. In an interview with Le Monde, President Nicusor Dan, elected in May, revisits the matter and discusses the differences between Europe and the US regarding the war in Ukraine.

title: Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhead: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

title: The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (1/4). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.
